UpTKKIKoNCfMy_I333I5Uw.text: This place is awesome and local. My favorite lunch spot during the week. The owner is funny and very personable. You won't be disappointed.

W-SUPdDUR8b_RJXvxQAM-g.text: This is a little gold mine tucked away.  I'm glad it was on Yelp.  My first visit...I will  be back.  I had the small chicken brown rice bowl with the sweet Thai chili sauce.  It was amazing!!!  I had two meals from the small bowl...lot of food.  The lady at the counter offered me various sauces to try before ordering. Great service and efficient.   For those of you who need to cater  office lunches...this a great option for something different in the workplace.  I will be back and bringing some friends !

-dAi7y3G1vupH_GaGK7JSQ.text: Seriously, stop reading this and go! All of the 5 star reviews are True. Food and staff are terrific. You will not be disappointed!

Ww9qsxrGB-7f0cOTUuUhmQ.text: Literally my favorite place to eat lunch I am a big fan of the Jamaican jerk shrimp rice bowl! Their sandwiches are amazing. Everything is tasty & most importantly fresh!. PLEASE try it if you haven't! The owner is super nice.

BG4S2uLQKsHmCRFF02-diw.text: Best thing I EVER yelped EVER!!  Had an amazing chicken Philly and saw countless other dishes for which I need to return. I sadly live like 500 miles away.

yt-8zQEuzRxCPDlc0aBydg.text: The owner is incredible. Great food and customer service. Gave me a sample of the curied Jamaican rice because I was undecided. Not anymore, this is a must go and eat. I'll make the trip from Huntersville again to try other flavors of the rice bowls.

lZqlCEkno61FhOQQX806Cg.text: Ok, first time I ever gave 5 stars. Very interesting place with a creative menu. The rice bowls look like they are the huge hit. My wife and I split a sub. Everything including the service was exceptional. This menu could support a much larger restaurant in my opinion.  A must try and you will be hooked like we are.

J9QNpB6LoIGMoIRlC0d62w.text: The owner, Roger, is very friendly. The rice bowls are good. The sandwiches are great. The specials and the fresh soups are amazing. Highly recommend the place. Friendly staff and good quality foods.

cy7y9Ssp7qbdXAA_PmOz_A.text: Wow, went here today for lunch; first time. Sooo good; Yelp reviewers got this one right! Got the Thai sweet chili sauce with chicken bowl and it was yummy. The man caught me looking at the menu, and asked if it was my first time and walked me through the flavors and their spice levels. Then I got a sample. I'll definitely be back to try other flavors and menu items!

fQMgOTMb7WTfo5bIbTuN6g.text: Really good! I came here after driving past for several days and my coworkers recommending I try it out. The owner and the cooks were very nice and helpful. Making sure it was just what I wanted. Considering I already love rice bowls this place is now a new favorite.

zHwrKhPm897_7AfIJgkVJQ.text: Excellent service...The owner Raja is amazing and takes pride in his food. For vegetarians out there even though there is nothing on the menu they cook up a nice veg rice bowl with amazing sauces. I took the mango habenaro sauce veg rice bowl and it was amazing.

xHueSirvnO1MQsfjMsDRXw.text: Very tasty indeed!  I'll be back!!!  Can't wait to try other flavors. Lots to try. Great tasty flavors mixed together for those with a diverse palate!  Don't miss out on this hidden little gem!!!   Partybuscharlotte org for party rockin' buses!!!

X8R2xfGENe2if4O4XbprfQ.text: This is a very good place to eat, especially if you like spicy food...I had the Jamaican jerk with the secret ingredient.... Ghost pepper cheese... Loved it... the only reason they didn't get 5 stars...I dint like the fries.. but hell I don't really like fries anyway

cFG-EaqJ5oA7fDc3AlgB6A.text: Not a big yelper. But I had to say something about this place. Amazing, fresh, made-to-order menu... Pico de gallo! Service that shines beyond any casual joint I've experienced. Balaclava will make you see the baby Jesus - and they INSISTED they warm it up... If the staff in this "mom & pop" continue to execute at this level, this wonderful, unpretentious little joint will become a destination spot. The location is a little tough... Seek it out! What's missing? Not much. Some craft beer and domestic would be very cool. Maybe as the place gets seasoned, some memorabilia on the walls. But believe me... If you live in the Steele Creek area you should support this new place!

py6S7d3iLWfKWp1G4FwNoA.text: Had a sweet Thai chili salad with chicken. Quality fresh ingredients. Great flavor. Chicken was a little tough but not a big issue. I work nearby and this a big step up from most of the places around here. Will definitely return and also will recommend to coworkers. They had me sample some spicy black beans that were good and also the jerk rice bowl and I regretted not getting the rice for lunch. Also everyone was friendly and hospitable.

jpC3vh2vlhC5ahvnBLLzqg.text: This place and the people who work there are awesome. I shamed to admit I've probably been there 7-10 times in the past 2 weeks. There's a good chance they sprinkle crack on their rice bowls, they are so good!!!

fys_uQm4kbTTelPN7RCS6g.text: The food and The service is the reason why I will go back. Small spot with no frills but the rice bowls are amazing, fresh and the sauces are tasty!!

Ihr2tlfdK7qU0CD8ZqGTBQ.text: Such an amazing atmosphere, the owner is a blast! Makes great conversation and let us sample all of the rice flavors to find our favorite flavor. The food is so delicious. If you like curry definitely try the Indian curry rice, it's spot on. Do not overlook this restaurant!

SpUbtlznKHPPgOq7PArJ-Q.text: I went to tasty bowl today for the first time! I told myself a while ago that no matter what comes to that location I'm not going to go because I am still mad Snoops closed! But today a really sweet girl came into my work and gave me a menu and it was filled with my favorite go-to lunch - chicken pitas! The prices were also slightly under what I'm used to for this area so I decided to head over and give it a try.  I had a really pleasant experience. The food was fresh, hot, and fast. In addition, the owner took the time to ask me where I worked and he even gave me a sample of his Thai sweet chili rice bowl and it was AMAZING! The sauces are homemade and everything is so fresh tasting! It was topped with pico de gallo and a layer of shrimp sauce - both of which were obviously homemade. The owner was kind and generous and when you combine that with fresh, delicious, reasonably-priced food - this place is destined for success!   Don't be afraid to try a rice bowl - I honestly wouldn't have ordered it but after trying the sample, I have no doubt I will be back quite regularly to chase down that fresh, saucy deliciousness!  **UPDATE*** 18 days and more than five rice bowls later, I can officially say this is one of the only places in Steele Creek that I CRAVE! Im so happy to see this place always busy...hopefully that means they will be around for a long time! It's definitely something delicious, unique, and really good quality in the area and was much-needed!!

iXmc80XgyTthahTofA3CoQ.text: First time in. Walk in the place is busy and the employees are working hard. Friday's special was shrimp and grits, which I'm not a fan of but everyone was ordering it. It was amazing I will definitely order again. Food was great service was great easy 5 stars

tKmc-qW2CKjBk-UX1qE9gQ.text: The shrimp rice bowl with jamaican jerk sauce was to die for!!! Will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States

sDqz0nVQG5rLDQQxb8ZKbw.text: Great place , Friendly staff good food reasonable price. The rice bowl had lots of flavor and can be custom. Location is easy to find. Busy but still severed quickly.

RofVnskZmB66l0q6CobtuQ.text: The owner was extremely polite and genuinely cares about his customers! The Best part was that the food was AMAZING!! I ordered the jerk/bourbon rice bowl!

dIXWnjcniDUeFwqTmEClfg.text: This was a great find.....I would have never known about this place if it wasn't for other reviews. The rice bowl was so good and they give you so much. I'm a big guy and I got the large thinking it was going to be breakfast but nope I still more than half left for lunch later on.

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. It looked so good when it came out I didn&#39;t think of doing a before picture until after. Chicken Rice Bowl with Sesame Ginger Teriyaki Rice

jkoULcEgBnAeHqIW0p2ofg.text: This is one of my favorite lunch spots. The owner is so engaging and cares about every customer. Once you go a few times, he knows your name and what you normally order. He knows I like it light on the sauce so it's not too mushy and he always puts just the right amount of sauce. If you eat in the restaurant he will come around chatting with the tables and making sure everything is good. The medium bowl is PLENTY of food (and maybe some leftovers). I always get the shrimp bowl with brown rice with the sesame ginger teriyaki sauce.

T4yzi_kVJ08NRwYCaLKipA.text: Ordered the curried jerk bowl with chicken. Spice level 9. Pretty tasty and a lot of food! If you're not sure, the owner is very talkative and helpful. Will be coming back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curried jerk bowl (spice level 9) was very tasty. Put a nice sweat on the forehead!

kF_5RZx5lqdk8_D-quIBLQ.text: This place is amazing! I try to stop by every time I'm in town. Ingredients are fresh and the regular sized chicken rice bowls always fill me up. The large bowl can definitely feed 2 people.  The owner is really accommodating and comes out to make sure the food is too your liking. Would highly recommend trying this hidden gem.

gfllxr4F98GuPiq5Jn4GdA.text: I think I love this place just because of its name - "Tasty Bowl Subs n' Such"? Genius. This place has a deli vibe but they serve not just sandwiches but also rice bowls with different sauces to choose from. The owner is super nice and will let you try a sample (rice and pico with the sauce you want to try in a decent sized cup). I've gotten the jerk and the teriyaki, and I have to say I do love the teriyaki. The jerk is also good but I thought it didn't work as well with the pico. Would recommend the chicken over the shrimp since they use the teeny shrimp that isn't the best.  Their fries are also AWESOME and just how I like em. They actually forgot to make ours so they threw in some onion rings which was very nice. Prices are reasonable and seating/parking is plentiful! Great quick lunch spot.

ZzaYbFL2Tw9qkWCGlbEtlg.text: Welcome to the neighborhood guys. This place has been open less than 6 months and it's quickly making a good name for itself. I visited strictly because of the great reviews on yelp so far.  I was greeted by the owner right as I walked in. His personality is very lively and infectious. You get how passionate he is about what he is doing.  I told him I had never been there before and so began the train of samples. It was unreal. "Try this, try this, try this". I was stuffed when I left and my order was to go.   The rice bowls are different. They like to play with flavors. It's like going to you buddies house that everyone says should open a restaurant. We'll this guy did.  My wife is celiac, so he ran through the ingredients he uses and made her something we both felt was safe for her to eat. She loved it. It was a buffalo chicken bowl.   I ordered the gyro, which was very good. I ate even though I was stuffed. To be honest, I bursting at the seams. My fault for over eating.  If you are in the Steele creek area, visit this small business and show them some love. They deserve it.

S9K9VknqgOdUFc03qG3_IQ.text: This place is close to where I work (just two buildings down) so I went here the first time for convenience but I've gone several more times since then because the food is actually really good.  I first got the teriyaki pita but since then I've taken a liking to their rice bowls which are really good.  I've been trying out the different flavors and each one has been great.  I'd recommend any of those to anyone trying this place for the first time.

U2M8PfePygloqPD_Vs_YBQ.text: One of my favorite spots around the city. Amazing amount of food for the price. My only complaint is the hours. Closes too early and I miss it a lot and closed on weekends. Would go a lot more if I could make it.

xuBWbhkA8pDD2ThuJHl2nA.text: Had the curried jerk small bowl for lunch today. It was great. The folks who work there were so friendly and concerned that I wouldn't get more spice than I could handle.  It turned out to be just right. Really good healthy food.  I did notice that there are zero options for vegetarians when they could easily do just a veggie rice bowl.  I try to order vegetarian generally but ended up getting chicken because I didn't want to be a pain.  I get the feeling they would have made a veggie bowl if I'd asked though.

ah3chgIbbK86t27YcWwagg.text: I just love this place. The food was amazing. I was impressed most by the jerk rice. I didn't say jerk chicken I said rice. The rice had jerk flavor and it was amazing. But my bowls were both good I bought 2. Asian Thai and jerk chicken. Excellent! And the staff are so charming and friendly. Go here!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Asian sweet chilli
Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerk bowl

JJZodSvH0OLc1MqboQPnlQ.text: I came here from a recommendation from a co worker. Let's start from the beginning. I walked in and am immediately greeted. I walk to the counter and inform them I've never been here before. They asked me my comfort level with spicy food. Told them and before I could say anything else, I had a sauce sample and a rice sample. And these samples aren't small. Think syrafoam ice cream bowl size full. Yep! He said we can make anything on the menu or we can whip something up. I let him do his thing and whip me up something. Excellent decision, he made me a mango habanero bowl. WOW WOW WOW!!!! So good. There are three different sizes I opted for the regular which was plenty enough for me. Roger is extremely friendly and wants to make sure everything is perfect to your liking. He is open to suggestions and criticism, which is awesome because it makes you feel as if your opinion matters. The price was perfect. Honestly $11 for my meal and a drink is great. Especially since I couldn't finish it and will finish it for dinner. So two meals for me for $11. I'm okay with that! Let's get into the flavor. Everything is so fresh and flavorful, it will linger on your tongue after. So so so delicious. I will return and I absolutely recommend everyone come out and try this. They close at 4.

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Bowl! Delicious!
Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Business card
Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mango habanero bowl.

AuKRRijz4cbalyKkRAou1Q.text: My step dad comes here all the time. I love the terayaki sesame ginger rice bowl. There pico is homemade and just the right amount of kick. They also have really good sweet tea.

5o6mKlq6GGXPAwerSIOulg.text: I was the envy of my office when I returned with my take-out from the Tasty Bowl.   The staff was a lot of fun and it was obvious that customer satisfaction (and interaction) is very important to them.   Looking forward to returning and trying more off the menu.

OjX-fX0o3f6SH7jDX1svnQ.text: Hubby had gyro & I had Italian (less peppers) & we shared fries.  Mine was very yummy and fresh. Hubby enjoyed gyro. I orders extra sauce but he didn't need. He found it to be extremely flavorful. We will be definitely be coming back soon & not just because we work within a mile or so down the rd.  Highly recommend them!   3rd trip - still great place. I meet Roger today & he has lots of info & suggestions. Please come in and give it a try!! You will not be sorry.

0nRGuJV_XwSCuERW7hkPNA.text: Awesome host and tasty food. Owner helps to understand the spice needs and made it perfectly as per my taste

7LDHuTmPIzBHXGjVeDIbbA.text: Great food, clean and friendly.  I was headed to the airport pulled them up on Yelp and was pleasantly surprised.  Thanks for lunch!

Z8egNjvMYDQK3CCX1kwLoQ.text: This is a tiny little spot in the corner of an office complex on Westinghouse that you'd miss if you aren't looking for it.  SO LOOK FOR IT!  I went with a friend and wasn't expecting much... boy was I wrong!  Fresh, friendly, reasonably priced and tasty!  The bowls are large (even the small size) and come with many options to make it just what you like.  The sub sandwiches are also tasty complete with warmed rolls.  The people are friendly and helpful, the owner is very outgoing and the sweet tea is on point!  There's no reason to not try this place unless you're in a group...  the actual square footage inside is small, so this is NOT a great choice if you have a group of 5 or more.

kplnZbwTT7VRJ59rqXrfgA.text: I've ordered Tasty Bowl to go three times. All times it has been amazing but the last one really blew me away. The first two times I ordered the Mexican chicken rice bowls and they were delicious. The regular size is huge.  Could easily cover two meals.   Today I tried the Jamaican Jerk Shrimp rice bowl which is a 9/10 on the heat scale. It was so delicious! The heat scale is no joke, it really did make me sweat. Sometimes spicy food can be so spicy it's unenjoyable but this was just perfect. Tasty to eat and left a nice kick of heat. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and you definitely get a ton of food with whatever you order. Can't wait to try the other flavors!! The owner is super nice and friendly as well.

7OK89kpx5fNDCEL9Nq7Ovg.text: This place is a diamond in the rough!  Mexican chicken rice bowl with pick is excellent. Their homemade hot sauce is delicious!  I'm addicted!  I came for the first time a month ago, and I already have a punch card with 4 stars!  Outside looks sketchy but it's worth it!

I51YBhBGNyXRR1zug6fSEw.text: Sweet Thai chili bowl with chicken and shrimp & bourbon bowl with steak & shrimp. So delicious!!!!! The owner is super friendly & he'll let you sample some of the sauces. I will definitely be back when I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; shrimp sweet Thai chili bowl
Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small beef &amp; shrimp bourbon bowl

lLi0h0IsWSsACz8MGMSZaA.text: Wanted to try this place for a long time and finally got the chance.  Like most reviews say, the owner guy is pretty cool, engaging, welcoming, interactive, etc., etc.,.  I immediately felt as ease even though it was my first time, the asked me how much spicy I like my food to be and I said "Indian spicy" so makes me a sample of 'Curried Jerk' rice and WOW!! one bite and I was in no doubt what I was going to order and I said 'this is good' and he says 'go on, finish the rest, you will feel the heat kicking in'.  lol Nevertheless I ordered the regular size bowl of Curried Jerk Chicken and another order of Mango Habanero.  He said, the Curried Jerk is about a 8 spice level and Mango Habanero is about a 5.   I had to wait for a few short minutes for my to-go order and the quantity of a regular bowl was more than sufficient for one.

lH_56686qZdNkT_HS28aRQ.text: This place is definitely a hidden gym. I discovered it on a yelp list and decided to give it a try. I'm glad I did. I went with the jerk chicken rice bowl. Many places list an item as spicy and it barely has any spice, but here spicy really does mean spicy which I can appreciate. Everything on the bowl tasted fresh and was cooked to perfection. The rice, which a lot of places slightly over cook, was absolutely perfect. The prices are SUPER reasonable for the portions that you get. I'm a big guy so I got a large thinking that's what I'd need to get full and I definitely couldn't finish it all. I ordered takeout via yelp so i didn't eat inside but it looked clean. The owner was super friendly and had me in and out in a jiffy. I'll be going back

oKnqnDzjlE79ij7y9ZLxNg.text: Awesome flavor and personalized service.  Owner is friendly and will know you by name after just one visit. Not sure what you want to eat and he'll give you a taste test.  I love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States

veET_7sJm1jZQy9KA-THkA.text: Let me start by saying we hands down had the best customer service experience in a very long time!! We were immediately greeted and the gentlemen behind the counter gave us a complete run down of the menu.. he let us sample several things and we were very impressed with the hospitality! He even let us try a new jerk chicken recipe that was not yet on the menu and it was amazing!! My husband and I ordered the jerk bowl and sweet tai and we were very underwhelmed. The chicken in the bowl was not seasoned at all and was a real let down! The other ingredients were okay but the chicken being boiled with no seasoning was a complete let down for my husband and I, so much we threw our food away!!! I would give this place five stars for customer service but the food unfortunately was disappointing

3R-xSIP8hu9mR1C3XMEOFA.text: This is one of my favorite lunch spots. It's always hard to catch them since they have specific hours. The people are so nice and the food is quite tasty. I always get the mango habanero with shrimp

NiovBx3jVdgdk0VkfhdP1g.text: Go hungry. You get tons of food. Not only is the food good the owner makes sure you enjoy it. Good food, good prices and a great owner what more could you want.

NsFzo6logAXw1UKq4-3xsQ.text: As many other reviews have stated, the owner's personalized attention and care that each customer enjoys their food is what sets this place apart and earned its top notch online reputation.   The food was excellent and the vibe of the place was laid back, relaxed and set up to have a great lunch experience.  My wife and I are already trying to determine when we will be able to come here for lunch again.   An excellent, eclectic choice in the Steele Creek area that is good enough to draw people from every corner of Charlotte.

V7S8BV624Qebm9Gcr_Dd5Q.text: The owner is hilarious and engaging with the customers. If you don't know what you want, he'll whip something up for you and it's always delicious.

TJG4WoNbPuyOICSC9RPItw.text: Mouth watering rice bowls? Yup Tasty Bowl Subs N Such has them. I've been scoping this place out via yelp for a couple of weeks now . I decided today for lunch im going to finally try this place i have a good feeling im going to love it. Low and behold i called to place a order so it would be ready when i arrived and Raja who's the manager answered and he could tell i was unsure of what i really wanted i heard so much about the jerk chicken bowl when i mentioned it to him he asked did i like spicy food? I told him yes to a certain extent so he took it upon hiself to say hey tell you what when you come in ill give you a few samples so you can decide which rice bowl you want to order,surely when i arrived he said i been waiting on you, he did as he said he would and fixed me up a sample to make sure it wasn't to spicy for me if thats what i really wanted,well it was a winner and i was sold! Noticebly i realized Raja knew alot of the customers by name which let's me know he engages alot with his customers, now that i think about it he even asked me what my name was when he gave me the sample, also i noticed him walking around asking everyone how was their food etc, he will go very far, with all of that being said i ordered my Jerk Chicken Bowl and was on my merry way!

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerk chicken rice bowl

Ues1452GmqPVNW1u7z2g1A.text: This is a cool little spot. It's only open Monday-Friday and only during the day. Owner is great & the food is a fusion of different cuisines. All of it thrown into a bowl for consumption. Ask for extra sauce & be prepared to need a mint to overcome the onions BUT well worth it. I keep going back for lunches!

YOTupVmzg0mrv3O19cUOzQ.text: Ordered again today.  Food was excellent again.  Owner as friendly as ever.  I order 3 on a scale of 5 and not spicy at all to me.  Going to go hotter next time.  (Owner will know who I am)  :-)  One tip... the large and regular appear to have the amount of "good stuff."   The difference is the amount of rice you get in my opinion.  Since I ordered from here in close proximity of dates, it was fresh in my memory.  In other words, don't order the large as its a couple bucks more for just more rice.

3iYlF7M2rS9st4_142Xhhg.text: Tasty Bowl is a hidden gem here in the Steele Creek area. They have the best fries not only in Charlotte, but anywhere. I highly recommend this place for a fast, delicious lunch. The prices are very reasonable and the portions are huge. The Indian curry rice bowl is out of this world. Get the fries. And get the onion rings. You won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States

0JPsPuS-4ta57BR2xSGWaA.text: Owner very friendly offered us samples as he recognized us as first timers.  Food was very good and came out quickly.   The rice bowls were much better than I have had at other places.  Definitely a go to lunch spot.

SoJxHbMz_BcTllPMfazHnw.text: This place is great. Highly recommend! I always order from here when they are on Foodsby in Ballantyne, and never disappoints. I actually got a call when I placed my order today, concerning how I would exactly like my meal prepared. The owners do actually care about their customers, and go out of their way to make sure you enjoy what they are preparing. EXCEPTIONAL food, and customer service! Imagine That!

SIXz5bEIB-3yC_2nbELQDA.text: I love this place! The food is great and the staff is very nice. If you want to taste the sauces they will mix some up for you right away.   Great lunch spot!

3zWwYYbmUfPyged120Axcg.text: Addictive! This place offers a very distinct taste that you can only get here! I don't like to leave reviews soon after I try a place, but I've eaten here 3 times in 3 weeks so hey. I usually get the Jerk chicken rice bowl with a level 9 for spice!  I LOVE IT! Sometimes the spice is overwhelming but the flavor is still there. The staff tries to call you by your name and make the experience more personable. It's really clean looking in the back. Nice little spot.

GQg-C2sBUsCQgxOphWRA-Q.text: I definitely recommend trying the rice bowls. I had the jerk chicken rice bowl. Amazing! So much flavor popping in my mouth, the spiciness isn't overpowering, just wonderfully put together.  The staff was very helpful & friendly. I will definitely be back to try other flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States

TI3DSSbJXdyWCP4TxRiu7Q.text: The food was so good & the customer service is amazing! The owner, Raja, is hilarious. They ask you what it is that you like and gives you a recommendation. I had to try this place, it had nothing but great reviews and I'm glad I did. It was definitely worth it. Everything is so fresh. We had the Thai spicy chili and the jerk chicken bowl.

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small Sweet and chili Thai chicken bowl &amp; Regular Jerk Chicken bowl

IUUKHgDxZ9AKtztHvXulWQ.text: I was looking for takeout options for lunch this afternoon, and thanks to Yelp recommendations I found this gem. I work in Uptown Charlotte, so this was about 20 minutes away, and after reading all of the rave reviews I did not mind the drive at all.   I decided on a regular sized Curried Jerk Chicken Rice Bowl, and I am so glad I did! The host said that it was a 6 out of 10 on the spice scale, and to be honest it was the absolute perfect amount of spice. Still gives that heat kick while remaining very flavorful.  Although this is a bit of a distance away from my work, I foresee myself returning here for lunch again and again to try all of the different sauce options they have. So happy I found this place!

3NF3QBUwwiEoBPK5IxUN2Q.text: Great food! Quick Service! Friendly! Try these guys, you won't be disappointed. The choices are extensive and can be customized as desired.

GXYTHs6JAHOcn0L4fXmGGA.text: Unreal.  Indian sub is out of this world good.  Definitely coming back!  Found my new favorite sub/rice bowl place in charlotte!

nH2sNFKa2rAiXdsOOaL3Fg.text: One of my favorite places to have lunch! The bowls are delicious!! My favorite is the sesame ginger! I have tried others and they are deliciously well. Nice fresh taste& the staff are always friendly. They also have punch card for frequent customers. Definitely a must try!

OZSYcJVA64B_yKaPPmdqvQ.text: Clean , local It's great for workers the area for a fast lunch.  I had a burger.. it was a little too pink for my taste..  next time I will try something else

9RUGnAF0VvsaZgTnvSorwQ.text: Love this place! The food is delicious and the workers make everyone feel like family! Wish I could convince them to open on weekends or do meal prep! Would love to have this as an option when friends and family come to visit!

-rZswSV2x2RuWAkJhfBtXQ.text: Great place and the staff are awesome -- I was in town for a certification course and didn't get much time for lunch. They were really fast and efficient on the orders. Lots of people in there eating and you can tell they are frequent visitors. Would recommend and will be going back for sure!

dX3CCPCjiQcTk9kG61HwFA.text: This is my first time eating here, and I will be back. The woman at the counter was very friendly. She started off by asking me if I liked no spice, little spice, or a lot of spice. The answer to that question helped her determined which bowl would be best for me, and she even made me a little sample. My chicken pieces were kind of big, but that's just a personal preference.   I ordered the Sweet Thai Chili Chicken Bowl (small)

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States

gvAImI1a84ZXm5XrFCg8CA.text: A newer place not to far from my office, and the food is great! Put together rather simply, but complex in flavors and sauces, and very tasty! The owner and staff are characters with great personalities, very friendly and helpful, and their customer service is a great example for how other companies and restaurants should operate! Already planning another trip back next week with other "virgins" from work!

wcVB6OGu5Hzy5scls_Qelg.text: I need to update my review already!   This place is fantastic! I tried a different bowl this time and it was delicious. The owner remembered us! And even came to sit with us to make sure we enjoyed our meals.   Top notch service!   They have a new loyal customer and forever fan!

Gfb5_1lA8YtQ6dVWDhC5VA.text: I was very intimidated by the menu but the owner recommended a grilled chicken bowl with sweet Thai chili sauce and it was amazing! I will definitely be back.

gac2qyRpmpmkSu0gOPARLg.text: Very disappointed.. got the chicken rice bowl with Jamaican jerk sauce. The whole bowl was bland and the chicken was incredibly dry. The so called marinated chicken tasted like it was marinated in boiling water..It tasted like the cheap can chicken you get a grocery store . Then the jerk sauce while it added heat(as in spicy) it was white? and had no relation to what Jamaican jerk Sauce actually taste like. Hope this was just a bad day for them .

57l4XvyWo7IvRumiy6Fi1A.text: What took me so long to get here?!   The outside is nothing spectacular but do not be dismayed! If there is a line, it moves quickly so relax... it's worth it.   I wanted nothing but a rice bowl the other day so that's what I searched for (via Yelp) and this place came up. I looked at the menu and figured I would give it a try since they offered both Jamaican and Curry jerk rice options. The prices vary by the size, but my regular rice bowl totaled a little over $9.   Again, most places say their food is spicy and they somehow disappoint but this did not! Not only did I receive my food quickly (5-7 minutes), during the lunchtime rush, but it was GOOD! It was fresh, healthy and hearty all in one! But they have Philly's that look and smell delicious if you're not opposed to mid-day 'itis.   I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled Chicken Rice Bowl with Curried Jerk Brown rice

YOGxACmFvjGBslpM6NT0_w.text: The Tasty Bowl Subs and Such is truly a  hidden gem of Westinghouse Blvd. I ran across this restaurant playing around on Yelp and I'm glad I stopped in with a friend and my mom for lunch.   Being our first time we were full of questions. The owner Raja was very helpful. He asked what flavor spiciness we liked and created a few samples for us to try. I let my mom try one of the samples and she said it was too sweet so Raja created a new sample for her and it was a winner.   The concept for the rice bowls is very simple. You get rice, choice of sauce and meat (chicken or shrimp) and pico de Gallo. The menu is a little misleading cause there is a miss print but you only get one meat choice with the price on the menu or you can have both for an extra charge.   The bowls were amazing. What's really impressive is the size. We all ordered the small bowl and couldn't finish. We ordered a Sesame Ginger Teriyaki, Mexican and Thai Sweet Chili bowl and 2 orders of fries. The fries are very crispy and seasoned well. I'm not a fan of pico but I was very trusting of Raja and the mix of rice, chicken and pico was outstanding.   Raja came by our table to make sure we were all satisfied with what we ordered. He made some spicy sauce for my friend to add to her bowl. He's very personable and we learned he even remembers his regular customers choice of spiciness.    I will definitely be back. There are so many flavor options and I want to try the subs and their wings!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Regular size Mexican rice bowl -chicken and shrimp
Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Regular size Sweet Thai Chili rice bowl
Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side of fries

VyHxZlGeFyWRYvyyVwENdw.text: Walked in and the owner asked us if it was our first time and it was. Right then we were offered samples based on his recommendation (since we were open to about everything) and our spice level.   One bite of the Thai sweet chili and Jamaican Jerk rice... BLAST OF FLAVOR! I was planning for a pita but the rice was too good. Maybe next time! In the end we got the Jamaican Jerk and Mango Habanero rice. I LOVED the Jamaican Jerk, and the spice lvl 8? was no joke. It built up haha. My bf preferred the Thai sweet chili but everything was delicious nonetheless. No lack of spice at all but I will definitely get more pico de gallo and we are super excited to come back next time to try the other flavors.   Hidden gem. People who work in the area have probably known about it for awhile but for newcomers, this is a place you won't regret :)  We will be back for the owner's friendly/inviting gestures, rice bowls, and maybe their homemade fudge too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jamaican Jerk and Thai Sweet Chili (Regulars)

XaLPXKjMirYyFekS9f0ToQ.text: Food is really really good and the service is excellent.  Don't be fooled by the obscure location.  This place is the real deal. If you want great, tasty, different food come here.  If you aren't sure what to order they will help you and even let you taste different dishes before you order.  Definitely worth a visit or ten!

hqxg6gQx78eow2m5o_r9ag.text: Great food, friendly staff, fast service, clean restaurant. Make sure you know your own spice level before ordering!

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States

JX1RIWFY-Rb5649Cb7rJCg.text: I have been trying to go and try out it and it was the best bowl I've ever had I don't care what other place sells bowls no one does it better than they do here. I 100% would recommend this place to everyone looking for something new to try.

wQimrrl4uYKTRbij_kwoqQ.text: (1/26/17) I just noticed  the  pick up order function  here on Yelp, definitely  a nice feature. Something  that's  a  bit new is samples of everything  that Raj thinks that you might like. It's a great  way  to  try things you haven't  had before  and to think how delicious  they would  taste  in a rice bowl.  Today I'm  having  another  I don't  know. I have no idea what's  in it other than steak and shrimp  but it's always  flavorful. It turned out to be a Teriyaki Jerk rice bowl that wasn't big on heat & spice but rather on flavor. It made a nice change to my spices from hell voyage that I had been on since I knew about the place. Tasty Bowl is branching out from the rice bowls and now offers soups, chili & pasta dishes. Every day there's a different special. If I could I'd eat there every day but for now I have to limit myself to one or two days at most.

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dining room

9TzehTOSw3g50NJEh2oLAw.text: Great little spot for lunch. Visited with coworkers for lunch. It was not to busy so we were able to get samples to determine flavor and spice level.   I ordered a small sweet Thai chili bowl with shrimp. Great portion size. The flavors were bold and yummy. The sauce is similar included is like the shrimp sauce I've had with hibachi food.   You can choose from the many options with the rice. You can choose white rice or brown rice. Then you can add proteins including chicken, shrimp, and I believe steak.   I also noticed that they have traditional subs, salads, and Nathan hotdogs on their menu.   We beat the lunch crowd, arriving around 11:45a. The restaurant is in a busy park area.  It is recommended that you call in your order and then come right in to pick up your food. I enjoyed the food and will be back to try other menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet Thai Chili Bowl with shrimp

jKv-51uxLypxWqm1JsEytQ.text: Always good, quick and delicious.  Pro tip: order online before you show. It will be hot and ready.  Pro tip part two: large is large enough for two lunches.

Us8iszeqTWQflLYgdAgz5g.text: Awesome lil lunch spot! As other reviews have pointed out the service is awesome- they're clearly passionate about the food they make and want the thing you order to cater to your preferences, and they offer samples to make sure you're getting what you want.   The rice varieties are varied and span a lot of different flavors/cuisine types. They offer three different sizes for bowls, and honestly the small is plenty but for hungrier times/if you want leftovers the other two options are nice.   Also super reasonably priced for what you get! We spent less than $20 between the two of us for lunch and that included some drinks.   Stop in! It's kind of in a weird spot, but you'll be glad you did.

hwuqiqTHmN9cocticOZ_xA.text: TLDR: The food is fresh, innovative, and specially prepared. More importantly though, the people and the service they provide each customer is exceptional. They are genuine, down to Earth, real people that make your meal an incredible experience. I would recommend you try something, but the people there will do it better than I ever could.

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bourbon jerk bowl
Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Reaper buffalo wings, spice level 12/10

UdGqY3p5-kT0ArNAJFs4FQ.text: It's about time I give these guys a much deserved review. They've got some things down pat about the food business. Service is where it's at these days. I visited for the first time months ago and made it back again just recently. They were certainly worth a second visit (and a coupon in the mail didn't hurt either).  At first it's a bit overwhelming - lots of flavors make the menu seem like too much to consume in a short moment. But if you're new and there's not a line forming behind you, they'll give you a sample taste of any of the many flavors mixed into a few bites of rice. On my latest trip I couldn't decide between the Indian curry and the Thai. So they just said "Hey we can mix the two together." Sweet! And spicy! It made for a good mix. I got brown rice - trying to stay healthy y'all - but white rice is an option. There are three sizes and I gotta say, the smallest is enough. They package them in plastic take-out style bowls and give you a lid just in case. They know you will probably end up taking some home.  Now of course there must be some downsides to counter act all the good press. The prices are a bit high, though it's about the going rate for comparable types of food these days. The location is a bit out there and inconvenient but, I know they're doing good business at lunch with all the companies close by. And the chicken in the bowls left a little something to be desired. It was cooked dry and without seasoning. Nothing that the excellent sauce variety can't make up for. Last but not least, the staff here is incredible. Family run for the most part but even the non-family staff have always been friendly great to talk to. They make you feel welcome and have tapped into the next wave of brick and mortar business: good service!

1zs0AWIZIRwCDAGkJgt07w.text: I liked this place so much I came two days in a row while I was in town for a work trip!!  The owner is hilarious and really cares that you enjoy your food. I wasn't too sure what sub to order so he asked me how much I like spicy...well I LOVE spicy stuff so he said go for the Bull Rider and I will make it extra spicy for you. That sandwich was on point. Nice and spicy (they can make it not spicy if you want too) and a really good amount of food for the price. He was even hanging out with some regulars at another table while I was eating. Very cool.  The other time I came I went for one of the rice bowls. Curried jerk and grilled shrimp. It was awesome. I got the regular and it was a ton of food (especially for the very reasonable price). Both times I stopped in I had one of the mango juice drinks...super tasty and from some company in Jamaica. Not something you can get everywhere!  Its easy to pass by the place..in a random office complex in a mostly industrial area. The inside is simple with a good amount of seating. Hopefully I get another work trip to the area because it was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bull rider sub with chicken

qKgDT2Gqq5MooLEF_5qqYA.text: I've been wanting to come here for so long now, but with it only being open for lunch on weekdays, it was a bit of a challenge. We finally made it out recently for a team lunch.   Everything was awesome from the moment we walked in. The owner came out from the kitchen and asked if we had been there before. When we said we hadn't he asked us our preferences on spice level and flavors and then brought us each a different sample to try. The samples were delicious and he continued to provide recommendations based on the other questions we asked.   I got a large chicken rice bowl with a Thai/Curry sauce combo. He ended up giving me an extra large bowl instead and it was so much food! I got multiple meals out of it. The food was amazing and flavorful. I also got a side of fries which was not necessary, but also delicious.   You order your food at the counter and they bring it to your table for you. Everyone's food came out pretty fast.   I cannot recommend this place highly enough! I will definitely be back in the future. It's worth coming out of your way to try.

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thai curry chicken rice bowl

LctCv_wPex_J9mlZjIf1YA.text: Great place for lunch. I come here at least once every 2 weeks. The staff is always so friendly and the food is awesome. If your having trouble deciding what you want, the staff always offers a sample.

OvC0G_BLuv2qk3ULDHS2pQ.text: I came here for a team lunch with a few coworkers. It was pretty low key place. They've got a decent amount of seating and seem to get in a lot of customers for dine in and carry out. The food was pretty phenomenal. I was able to try their wings with Carolina Reaper sauce and those were extremely spicy but still quite a bit flavorful. The mistake I made was trying those before I actually had my chicken rice bowl with Thai chili sauce. It tasted really good but I couldn't catch the spice in it, most likely because my tongue was numb from the reaper sauce. Definitely a note to self to not have that sauce before trying anything else the next time I come. But the bowl was really tasty overall and I love all the sauces and vegetable they add to it. They also give you a large amount of food as well. I was so full off barely eating half of my bowl and two wings that I was able to save plenty for dinner later that night. And because my taste buds had recovered I was actually able to get more flavor and spice from the Thai chili sauce! Try it if you get a chance to come here. It's pretty tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled Chicken with Pico de Gallo Bowl w/ Thai Sweet Chili Sauce
Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings w/ Carolina Reaper Sauce

VXKl4EOJGsuL8gMKxULI6g.text: First of all, #YelpCLTTop100, check out the list if you haven't, because these guys made it all the way to #2 on the list! So how in the world haven't I heard about them or been here yet? Probably because since I'm a North Charlotte guy, Steele Creek might as well be Narnia as far as I'm concerned. Even if you're well versed in the area (my office is only 4 miles away) you're liable to miss it or pass right by. It's in a bit of a weird spot in a commercial office park and on a lower elevation than the rest of Westinghouse, so you really have to know exactly where you're going.  All that being said, when I saw this place so high up the list, I had to give it a try. Since work isn't too far away, I ventured up here on Friday afternoon and walked into a very simple but clean restaurant. It was off-peak lunchtime but there were still about 6-7 tables enjoying their meals as well as a handful of people picking up to-go orders. There was one REALLY loud guy behind the counter running the show: Expediting, cooking, taking orders, talking to regulars, etc etc. If he wasn't the owner, he was clearly the mastermind of the day. When it was my turn at the counter the first question he asked was if I had been there, and when I said no, he had a quick questionnaire to see what I was in the mood for. After a quick-fire Q&A, he gave me a small sample of some rice with seasoning and it was honestly the most dynamic combination of flavors I've had in a LONG time. I told him whatever was in that, I wanted a regular portion of it!  I find out at the register that I was getting the Thai Sweet Chili Chicken rice bowl, which was perfectly fine with me. The wild guy behind the line (who I later found out is Raja) was a delight. He has one of those personalities where he can relate with pretty much anyone and has you literally eating out of the palm of his hand!! After a 5-10 minute wait I was out the door a mere eight dollars poorer with what I already knew was going to be an delicious meal thanks to the sample.  When I got back to the office, I could really appreciate all the work and creativity that goes into The Tasty Bowl's food. First of all, a "Regular" sized rice bowl is still huge! You get a generous helping of perfectly cooked rice, huge chunks of chicken, and topped with the sauce and veggies of whatever style you choose. Everything just worked so well together. There were both creamy and spicy components of sauces (it looked like two different sauces), crispy and fresh aspect thanks to the shaved veggies on top, moist cubes of chicken, and all in a piping hot package that was just incredible. The spice-level was exactly what I was hoping for. The questions that Raja asked are spot on for pinpointing exactly what you want.  I mean, how can you not give a place five stars when after meeting someone just once, you'd eat literally anything he put in front of you without question? With this food this good so close to work, I'll be back again, and again, and again! In fact, if it wasn't for the fact that they're closed on the weekend, I would have come back the next day!  Food so good you'll get goosebumps. Great prices with an amazing team that show their passion quite clearly in their trade. I'm sold!

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mango curry bowl (front left) and Buffalo Reaper (back right).
Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice!

-1UkMj0Jj68XoCGxA1lUNg.text: Some of the friendliest counter folk, perhaps ever. At least some of it could be due to the location - despite knowing where you are going, you need to be on the lookout, as they are not only in a business park, but the park itself is a bit downhill from the road, and there is not a ton of signage, so be prepared.  Once there, you also need to figure out how to get in. They are located on the corner, but the "main" door is over on the one side, and there is a back door (somewhat like the back door at McDonald's, that is by the bathroom), and you can go in that way, but you'll end up in the back. The front door is a bit better.  Regardless, once you are there, they ask if you've been. Since it was my first visit, I don't know if they do this for everyone, or if it was just me, at which point they asked if I wanted to try some rice (or perhaps if I liked rice, but the idea is about the same). Since I'm all about the rice, I went with it, and then proceeded through a few other questions to try and find a good menu option. Several tastes later (and rapidly getting filled up already), their suggestion was a jerk chicken.  It actually was tasty, but I'm not a huge fan of jerk, so I decided to go a different direction, with something more Asian/Thai inspired. Again, the flavors were good, but a couple of things did just not hit the taste buds quite right.  The rice was a bit wet. This isn't a horrible thing, but it meant that it wasn't like a fried rice. The other thing is that the Thai Chili (closest I can come to describing the sauce) was more of a sweet sauce, with little heat to it. They did add some homemade hot sauce, but it wasn't a Thai sauce, more like a Tabasco or Texas Pete.  Since I was rather full already, I saved half of the regular (?) - the medium sized bowl and ate it later, at which point the flavors had mingled nicely. Ultimately it was a nice experience, but for those particular flavors, I think I would go elsewhere, and perhaps choose a different direction.

uyv7nkaoTfDPEZA-g-DiVw.text: This is my second time here and the customer service again was on POINT. The owner/manager came out to ask how our food was and engaged the customer. This place is such a hidden gem. I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ginger teriyaki bowl with shrimp

V6xce0VHxANIBQsZf6LlwQ.text: Sometimes when you first bit into food it awakens all the happy centers in your body.  This is what happened to me when I ate here.  Based on one visit I am making plans to go back.  I had the Italian sub and some onion rings.  Both were exceedingly good.  The onion rings are the best I have had in North Carolina.  The location is somewhat off the beaten path but well worth the drive.  I live eighteen miles away and would drive there for the food.  That says something.   The place is casual, efficient and clean.  You order at the counter and they bring the food to your table.  Unfortunately, they posted a sign that they will no longer offer the sandwich menu starting May 1st.  They have other things on the menu so I may have to give the rice bowels a try.  Go here is you want a pleasant dining experience.

OsCOcACjeaS_jQkyb8aJpw.text: This little restaurant showed me something different than one usually finds -- hospitality. I was greeted immediately, was given 2 samples to try and the woman who was helping me explained all about how the restaurant worked, how I could adjust the spice level and various other options. I ended up having the beef curry rice bowl and it was delicious. The small size was good for lunch. After I started to eat the chef came out to talk with me and he was happy I was enjoying my meal. He proceeded to talk to me about how he wasn't quite satisfied with the beef he was using and that he is experimenting with different cuts to make sure his customers only get the most tender and flavorful steak. He invited me back to have the same dish in a couple weeks after he finishes experimenting. While I ate he periodically came out from the kitchen to talk with diners and make sure they were happy. He had friendly conversations about travel and food which was nice to see.  One of the best indicators of the restaurant's hospitality is that the staff knows many customers' names and the customers know the staff's. Clearly these are people who return to eat here often. I will be joining them!

CHieB8ptk2vog5LunRIQ1Q.text: How is something this good so far out of the way!? My pal and fellow YELPl-er Chris S, insisted that I eat lunch here one day while we were prepping up for a charity event. During the drive there, I began to suspect that I was being kidnapped. Good news, I wasn't, which is good because I am pretty sure the ransom my wife is willing to pay wouldn't get Chris very far.   The owner, Raja, is a bigger than life personality who remembers, apparently, every single human being who has ever walked through the door and after the 3rd or so time, their orders. He is loud, gregarious, coarse, and funny as hell. He hands out samples in sizes that make eating lunch harder. I had 4 samples and could have gone home happy but I stayed for a shrimp bowl with reaper buffalo sauce, grilled veggies, pico and who else even knows but him and it was fantastic. The building of flavors and textures was wonderful. The shrimp were plentiful and perfectly cooked.   This joint isn't just a place to eat, it's a place to be. To shed your issues of the day for a few minutes of crazy and crazy good food. I WILL be back and only wish I got travel credits on my CC to get there and back, but it's worth ever minute and every mile.

CMx_6fNrd_ZsU5XBNXUqGg.text: I recently went here for the first time to eat lunch, and I really enjoyed the food. After having an opportunity to try some samples, I settled on the least-spicy teriyaki sauce on top of a chicken salad. I know that sounds like a weird combination, but just put your trust in the staff's suggestions and you won't be disappointed.   As for the service, the head chef identified early on that I had never been to the place and so he took the time to explain the menu, offer me some samples, and make suggestions based on my personal preferences. Considering that this was during lunch hour on a weekday, I think that's pretty awesome of him.   I do have to warn that he sometimes uses language that isn't what I'd consider "family friendly", and at times it could be downright offensive depending on who he's speaking to, but something tells me he doesn't really care what you think about how he talks. Overall I appreciated his straightforward style and even got a few laughs out of it.   Based on my experiences so far, this place is certainly worth a visit if you're in the area.

QnyZhEGE9PT3yQjrCCgV2A.text: We went in for our first time today so we could see what all of the rave Yelp reviews were about and we were not disappointed. The owner was very helpful and asked us a few questions about our taste and spice preferences. After the questions he made us some quick samples and he was spot on with the flavor profiles.   The Gyro was great, but my Thai sweet chili and Curry bowl was crazy good. A regular order is an abundance of food and I ate it all because I couldn't stop!!!  The only down side to this joint is they are only open during the week and close at 4pm which makes it hard for me to get there, but if you want something out of the ordinary with friendly service, you must try the Tasty Bowl!

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thai sweet chili and Curry shrimp

bWMR-AhzDJePsN3yEEBiHg.text: Friendly, clean, seemingly healthy and very filling. I stopped for lunch at The Tasty Bowl, which is just off South Tryon on Weestinghouse. Subs and rice bowls on the menu, I decided on the chicken bowl with sweet and sour pineapple on top of brown rice. When my name was called a few minutes later, a major amount of lunch was ready.  A little sweet but tasty with flavor and lots of chicken. Crisp and crunchy vegetables and the rice was very soft. I cleaned the bowl.  As I was leaving, the owner sincerely apologized for not being available to make a recommendation. I don't know why - this was great!

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken bowl, regular size
Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such in Charlotte NC

AVSSNrJiNTNvs7_Q18vOLQ.text: All of my orders have been deliveries via FOODSBY so far but one day I plan to make a visit. There are only a few menu items available using the service but everything I've tried from Tasty Bowl has been prepared well. Even though I haven't been to the physical location, I will attest that customer service is awesome, I recieved a phone call and text from Tasty Bowl regarding an order once just to clarify what I wanted. They didn't have to do it but they did and I appreciated it. Rice bowls and wings are good. Im not a big rice eater but the flavor of the meat and added sauces were really good. This time I tried the gyro and I was pleased. I always use Showmars as a guide and this one was up there with them if not better. I will definitely continue eating from Tasty Bowl when possible.

hK0esnFZa1UB-p20mbWkmw.text: Not bad at all. A friend recommended that we go here on her lunch break. She's a big fan.   The staff was awesome. Even before I ordered my food one of the people ( I believe the owner ) walked up to me and my toddler and asked if I'd like him to put something on the TV for her. He was really friendly and went out of his way to bring her a drink.   The food was good and fast. I got the bourbon sauce with the chicken and rice bowl. Not the best bourbon sauce I've had but definitely not the worst.  Im a big fan of Asian style bourbon sauce. The pico de gallo they put on top was very good! Both friends are regulars at this spot so needless to say they also enjoyed their food.   I would recommend Tasty Bowl. Will definitely be going back, hopefully will my husband. They have a mango habanero flavor that I'm sure will be calling his name. Wish I knew about this place when I worked over that way. It's a great place to stop for lunch if you work in the Charlotte Premium Outlet/Steele Creek area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Tasty Bowl Subs N Such - Charlotte, NC, United States

zVtLCjMOJ6xCCcN8ZmFLqQ.text: I recently started a new job in Charlotte and noticed my coworkers all coming back from lunch break with these deliciously smelling boxes of food over and over again. I thought I'd be nice one day and pick up one for myself and my coworkers, I told the nice lady on the phone my order and her customer service was phenomenal, asking on a scale of the 1-10 how spicy do I want mine. Who does that? I told her 7, and it was fantastic. The real treat was meeting the owner, Raja. He took time to introduce himself and tell me if I need to more or less spicy to let him know that way he can pretty much custom make my bowl for me. What! Once again, who does that? NOBODY IN TOWN! He was super friendly, asking what flavors did I get and then making some suggestions. This man genuinely cares about the people that come his restaurant. I can't wait to go back tomorrow and tell him about my review for his awesome restaurant!

hr7lymP9QTkJJEG-qGUIZQ.text: Great fresh food, lots of options and combinations and the owner goes above and beyond. I only at half my bowl and he topped off my rice for the rest of the meal. Give it a try.

NE5a-L4uUv9jaKq5mHmtMQ.text: Everyone here is amazing. The food is great, the experience great! I really appreciated the owner walking me through the food process and allowing my to try the rice before purchasing and following up after I finished my meal. Would definitely recommend and visit again!!

ytIucsu5_AQ6F754nsGShw.text: To keep it short: Great service - The staff were very friendly, and the owner was totally willing to answer any questions or offer some suggestions. He gave me a "sample" that could have been my lunch alone.  Even Better Food: Everything is terrific, very fresh, and in a very generous size. For the price and quality, can't beat it.

RYPXb25Gg2yKz-zGj_WqJQ.text: The owner is a very funny special guy. Friendly like an old friend. The food is out of this world! I don't normally leave reviews, but I feel like I have to, for a restaurant this good with good service.

AC5eKmWnablKZaVtDq1zvw.text: Raja is the man! I have been here about 4 times then I recently went back after about 6 months and he remembered my name

yb72eHVp5WxUbqE0HmIcGA.text: I crave this place all the time. Raja is the best and very personable.

D9KBsqbHwCYwhLVdRU7AWQ.text: I am a believer!! Been reading all these great reviews and finally in town long enough to try this place...FANTASTIC!!!  Service is amazing! Very friendly helpful owner and staff, and the food!!! Taste of heaven! Served up quick with so many amazing fresh flavors. Will be back, often as possible!!

mQDjzzFxsL9eCbkBB_NiqQ.text: This place is awesome! My coworkers and I were greeted as we entered the restaurant. The owner made us samples to try before ordering our meals. The food was delicious and the service was great.

kJVQzWgd_mpefViTkWv95Q.text: This place is awesome.  Been here twice now and left full, with a little bit left over.  Good size portions and fresh food.  The owner is very friendly and will answer any questions about the menu.  They are only open from 10 - 4 Mon - Fri but do not miss them.

IMRqhvL9k1-VH5aRCr5AdA.text: Ate  lunch here today with a friend. the food and service was excellent.  Mangoi rice bowl is a must have.

oLJT_Ef4Xd10xwjwzj67Zg.text: Sooo happy they opened closer to my office. I've had the rice bowl and garden bowl. I've had the sweet and sour pineapple and the bourbon. Everything is delicious! This is worth driving a few extra minutes. The staff is super friendly, the owner will come out in in-between cooking to check on customers. Did I mention how delicious the food is? You also get a lot for your money.  My whole office looked to come here for lunch.

0ujGsGI671IbfqrvN06m8A.text: Wow! Great food! Owner is very involved and loves to chat up his food (and for good reason). Explained I was from out of town and he still insisted I try a sample. Price was reasonable and quality was excellent. I will make a point of coming back next time I am in town on business.

P8u12bVWhW7wOmvmIiUsgA.text: I noticed this restaurant about a month ago and thought to myself "what an oddly placed restaurant" as it is in the middle of Westinghouse between South Tryon and 160.  I went back to my office and googled to see what they had to offer. Then today, based on those reviews, I decided to try it out. OMG I am so glad I did!!! Holy Moly, that was delicious! I walked in and was immediately greeted. After staring at the menu blankly for a bit trying to figure out what to order, I was asked if I had been there before. The moment I said no, I was asked if I like spice. I described the level of spice I can handle and bam, I had a sample handed to me, a good size sample.... and it was delicious. I ended up talking to Raja for a while about catering and the different offerings they have. He had asked for my name for my order and actually used my name several times rather than just to shout out my order was ready (which would have been odd anyway as it was ready within the time we were still talking and I was standing right in front of him lol). I ordered the Sesame Ginger Teriyaki, size regular, and sadly ate it all when I returned to my office (I could have stopped at half but it was so good!). If you are in the Steele Creek area looking for a new lunch spot, I highly recommend this place!!!
